description: In my work as a consultant I often meat teams that try to embrace the practice of code review. In most cases they treat it in the same way as children treat they daily spoon of cod-liver oil, don't like it but force themselves because they know it is good for them. But does it have to be so hard? To figure it out I will show you some common problems teams are struggling with and what are some preconditions that need to be meet in order to eliminate them.

title: Devoxx Poland 2016 - Łukasz Szydło - Preconditions for good code review
